result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas E Sternard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.
Consecutive to any sentence remaining in 13-CT-113. Huber release granted. Sentence to commence forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas E Sternard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas E Sternard in court with attorney Barry S. Cohen. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that Defendant enter plea and be sentenced on this case today, put off plea/sentencing in 14-CT-92 until after July 30. State has no objection, moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty.   State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
from Atty Cohen firming plea hearing scheduled for 3/13/15.

Defendant Nicholas E Sternard in court with attorney Barry S. Cohen.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Cohen anticipates all matters will resolve at next hearing, requests a plea date in February. State has no objection to continuance. Defense waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 22, 2014 at 08:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 10/13/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/25/15)
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.
Defendant appears on his own with counsel.

Defendant Nicholas E Sternard in court with attorney Elizabeth m Majerus.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court cancels warrant. Atty Majerus waives reading of the complaint, asks court to set an adjourned initial appearance to determine if her firm will be representing defendant in this matter. State requests cash bond. Atty Majerus gives argument on bond. Court makes statement, sets bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 11:30 am.
